moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 f6: Not the best way to decline the King's Gambit.
moves.3. Bc4: Smythe ignores Black's response and plays the move he was intending to play regardless.
moves.3... b6: ??? I guess the intention is to fianchetto the QB.
moves.4. f5 Bb7: Jenkins is ignoring the K-side, where the danger lies.
moves.6... Ke7 7. Qf7+ Kd6 8. Nb5+: This is why the Knight was developed before Q-R5 ch, in anticipation of flushing the K to Q3.
